content.title: Mukhya Mantri Samajik Suraksha Yojana: Death & Funeral Assistance (HBOCWWB)
content.details: The scheme 'Mukhya Mantri Samajik Suraksha Yojana' is implemented by the Haryana Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board (HBOCWWB), Labour Department, Government of Haryana. Under this scheme, financial assistance of ₹5,00,000/- shall be provided to the dependents/nominees of the registered construction worker in the event of the worker's death due to an accident occurring during the course of employment at the workplace. Additionally, the Board provides financial assistance of ₹15,000/- to the nominee/legal heir of the registered construction workers for funeral expenses.
benefits: Financial assistance of ₹5,00,000/- to the nominee/legal heir of a registered construction worker if the worker dies in an accident while working at the workplace.
Financial assistance of ₹15,000/- to the nominee/legal heir of a registered construction worker for funeral expenses.
eligibility: The applicant should be a nominee/legal heir of the deceased construction worker.
The deceased worker should have been registered with the Haryana Building & Other Construction Workers Welfare Board.
The scheme allows for application only once.
documents_required: Identity card of the registered deceased worker
Copy of FIR in regard to the accident
Inquiry report from the concerned area officer

faqs.question: Who implements this scheme?
faqs.answer: The scheme is implemented by the Labour Department, Government of Haryana, through the Haryana Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board.

faqs.question: What is the financial assistance provided under the scheme in case of a worker's death?
faqs.answer: The scheme provides ₹5,00,000/- to the dependents/nominee of the registered construction worker who dies in an accident at the workplace.

faqs.question: Is there any additional financial support provided under the scheme?
faqs.answer: Yes, the scheme also offers ₹15,000/- to cover funeral expenses for the nominee/legal heir of the registered construction worker.

faqs.question: Who is eligible to receive benefits under the scheme?
faqs.answer: The nominee/legal heir of the deceased worker who was registered with the Haryana Building & Other Construction Workers Welfare Board is eligible.

faqs.question: How many times can an applicant apply for the scheme?
faqs.answer: The scheme allows for application only once per eligible nominee/legal heir.

faqs.question: Where can one apply for the scheme?
faqs.answer: Applicants can apply for the scheme through the Official Portal - Antyodaya-SARAL Portal.

faqs.question: Can applicants track the status of their application?
faqs.answer: Yes, applicants can track the status of their application through the Antyodaya-SARAL Portal.
